standards.description: Classify whole numbers, integers, and rational numbers using a visual representation
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to classify whole numbers, integers, and rational numbers using a visual representation such as a Venn diagram to describe relationships between sets of numbers.

standards.description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide integers fluently
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to add, subtract, multiply, and divide integers fluently.

standards.description: Apply qualitative and quantitative reasoning to solve prediction and comparison of real-world problems involving ratios and rates
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to apply qualitative and quantitative reasoning to solve prediction and comparison of real-world problems involving ratios and rates.

standards.description: Identify independent and dependent quantities from tables and graphs
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to identify independent and dependent quantities from tables and graphs.

standards.description: Extend previous knowledge of triangles and their properties to include the sum of angles of a triangle
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to extend previous knowledge of triangles and their properties to include the sum of angles of a triangle, the relationship between the lengths of sides and measures of angles in a triangle.

standards.description: Apply mathematics to problems arising in everyday life, society, and the workplace
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to apply mathematics to problems arising in everyday life, society, and the workplace.

standards.description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide rational numbers fluently
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to add, subtract, multiply, and divide rational numbers fluently.

standards.description: Represent constant rates of change in mathematical and real-world problems
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to represent constant rates of change in mathematical and real-world problems given pictorial, tabular, verbal, numeric, graphical, and algebraic representations.

standards.description: Extend previous knowledge of sets and subsets using a visual representation
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to extend previous knowledge of sets and subsets using a visual representation to describe relationships between sets of real numbers.

standards.description: Represent linear proportional situations with tables, graphs, and equations
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to represent linear proportional situations with tables, graphs, and equations in the form y = kx.

standards.description: Write one-variable equations or inequalities with variables on both sides
standards.subject: Mathematics
standards.full_text: The student is expected to write one-variable equations or inequalities with variables on both sides that represent problems using rational number coefficients and constants.

standards.description: Plan and implement comparative and descriptive investigations
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to plan and implement comparative and descriptive investigations by making observations, asking well defined questions, and using appropriate equipment and technology.

standards.description: Compare metals, nonmetals, and metalloids using physical properties
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to compare metals, nonmetals, and metalloids using physical properties such as luster, conductivity, or malleability.

standards.description: Compare and contrast potential and kinetic energy
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to compare and contrast potential and kinetic energy.

standards.description: Recognize that the Sun provides the energy that drives convection within the atmosphere and oceans
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to recognize that the Sun provides the energy that drives convection within the atmosphere and oceans, producing winds and ocean currents.

standards.description: Plan and implement comparative and descriptive investigations
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to plan and implement comparative and descriptive investigations by making observations, asking well defined questions, and using appropriate equipment and technology.

standards.description: Observe and describe how different environments support different varieties of organisms
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to observe and describe how different environments, including microhabitats in schoolyards and biomes, support different varieties of organisms.

standards.description: Recognize that inherited traits of individuals are governed in the genetic material found in the genes within chromosomes
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to recognize that inherited traits of individuals are governed in the genetic material found in the genes within chromosomes in the nucleus.

standards.description: Describe the structure of atoms including the masses, electrical charges, and locations of protons and neutrons in the nucleus and electrons in the electron cloud
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to describe the structure of atoms, including the masses, electrical charges, and locations, of protons and neutrons in the nucleus and electrons in the electron cloud.

standards.description: Demonstrate and calculate how unbalanced forces change the speed or direction of an object's motion
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to demonstrate and calculate how unbalanced forces change the speed or direction of an object's motion.

standards.description: Describe components of the universe including stars, nebulae, and galaxies
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to describe components of the universe, including stars, nebulae, and galaxies, and use models such as the Hertzsprung-Russell diagram for classification.

standards.description: Describe the interactions that occur among systems in the human organism
standards.subject: Science
standards.full_text: The student is expected to describe the interactions that occur among systems that perform the functions of regulation, nutrient absorption, reproduction, and defense from injury or illness in animals.
